Chapter 4 FHR Examining Always check if the main unit and the probe are in good condition prior to use. Handle the probe with care. Do not drop it on hard surfaces. The 2MHz and 3MHz obstetrical probes are designed for FHR examining. The 2MHz probe is optimized for deep penetration and is widely used in the third trimester pregnancy. The 3MHz probe is a general purpose probe. It has better resolution and wider detection range than the 2MHz 5 Close the battery compartment cover. probe, therefore is optimized for early fetal heart detection. Follow these procedures to perform FHR examining: 1 Feel the position of the fetus by hand to find the best position to detect the fetal heart. 2 Switch on the Doppler and the probe. 3 Apply a small amount of coupling gel to the acoustic face of probe; place the probe face at the best position for detecting fetal heart. Angle the probe to obtain an optimum audio signal. Adjust the volume if required. 3.2.2 Fitting Wireless Probe Battery Clear fetal heart sound should be heard from the speakers/earphone, and numeric FHR value should be displayed on the LCD. The wireless probe is powered by a lithium battery. To fit the battery for the probe: 1 The best quality records will only be obtained if the probe is placed in the optimum 1 Remove the screw on the battery compartment cover with a screw driver and then take the position. cover away with your hand. 2 Positions with strong placental sounds or umbilical blood flow sound should be 3 If the fetus is in the cephalic position and the mother is supine, the clearest heart sound will normally be found on the midline below the umbilicus. During examining, the pregnant woman’s prolonged lying in the supine position should be avoided owing to the possibility of supine hypotension. Sitting up or lateral positions are preferable and may be more comfortable. 4 It is not possible to examine FHR unless an audible fetal heart signal is detected. The fetal pulse can be distinguished from the maternal pulse by feeling the mother’s pulse during the examination. To clean the main unit, 2.2.4 Indicators Switch off the Doppler and unplug it from AC power supply. Wipe the case with a cloth that has (1) Main unit indicator been dampened in diluent ammonia <3%, ethanol 75% or isopropanol≤70%, and then dry it with The indicator of the main unit indicates the connection status of the main unit and AC power: a clean cloth. The recommended cycle is one week or when needed. The indicator lights up in green – the AC power is connected. Clean the probe after each use to avoid cross infection and prolong its useful life. The indicator flashes in green – the main unit is charging the main unit battery. To clean the probe, The indicator goes off – the AC power is not connected. Switch off the probe. Wipe it with a cloth that has been dampened in diluent ammonia <3%, ethanol 75% or isopropanol≤70%, and then dry it with a clean cloth. (2) Probe indicator The indicator of the probe indicates the status of the probe: CAUTION The indicator lights up in green – the probe is switched on. 1 Do not use strong solvent such as acetone. The indicator flashes in yellow when the volume control key is pressed – the volume has 2 Do not use an abrasive such as steel wool or metal polish. been decreased/increased to its minimum/maximum. 3 Neither the main unit nor the probe is waterproof; do not immerse any part of them in The indicator lights up continuously in yellow – the probe battery is low. liquid. Entry of liquid into the Doppler may destroy the equipment. The indicator flashes in green – the probe battery is being charged. 4 Do not allow any liquid remain on the surface. 6.4 Disinfection The Doppler has four modes: examining mode, recording mode, playing mode and setting mode. In the former three modes, the LCD displays as follows: In normal use the main unit does not need disinfection. In case of being soiled, clean the main unit case and disinfect it with 75% ethanol or isopropranol≤70% or glutaraldehyde≤3.6％. 1 6 After each use, clean the probe and disinfect it with 75% ethanol or isopropranol≤70% or 2 7 glutaraldehyde≤3.6％. 4 9 CAUTION Do not sterilize the main unit of the Doppler or the probe. - 9 - - 26 - SONOTRAX PRO 2/SONOTRAX PRO 2 Maintenance and Cleaning Introduction BLUETOOTH Ultrasonic TableTop Doppler User Item Description Chapter 6 Maintenance and Cleaning The battery is installed and the battery energy is full. 6.1 Inspection Battery Indicator The main unit battery is low.
